description:
Description

NetSPI, a pioneer in offensive security solutions, is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to power our data-driven innovation in cybersecurity. This role demands a combination of profound technical acuity, analytical dexterity, and leadership skills. As a Senior Data Scientist you will be responsible for discovering and championing unique use cases in the field of cybersecurity using vast amounts of invaluable data, as well as helping to operationalize those use cases.

You will be crucial in bolstering our proactive security market approach with a platform-driven strategy that addresses the pressing security challenges of our customers with high-quality solutions, significantly enhancing the their security stance.

A Senior Data Scientist at NetSPI will lead our endeavors in leveraging data-driven approaches to foster innovation within the cybersecurity domain. This role requires a blend of deep technical expertise, exceptional analytical skills, and strong leadership capabilities. As a Senior Data Scientist, your primary role will involve the development and optimization of sophisticated, scalable data infrastructures and pipelines. Additionally, you will play a critical role in converting raw data into meaningful insights that drive strategic decisions. Your responsibilities will include designing and implementing advanced data systems, collaborating closely with various stakeholders to ensure our solutions are perfectly aligned with customer needs, and playing a key role in the deployment and market introduction of our innovative NetSPI security platform.

Responsibilities
• Advanced Data Analysis and Modeling:
• Conduct comprehensive data analysis and develop sophisticated models to solve complex problems.
• Utilize machine learning, statistical analysis, and predictive modeling to drive insights and solutions.
• Machine Learning Algorithm Development:
• Design, test, and deploy innovative machine learning algorithms.
• Stay ahead of emerging trends in AI and machine learning to implement cutting-edge solutions.
• Strategic Contribution:
• Contribute to strategic discussions on data-driven decision making and innovation.
• Present findings and insights to stakeholders at all levels, including executive leadership.
• Cybersecurity Focus:
• Understand and apply principles of cybersecurity to data analysis and machine learning solutions.
• Stay current on cybersecurity trends and threats to inform data science initiatives.
• LLM Implementation and Optimization:
• Work with and fine-tune Language Model Learning (LLMs) for specific cybersecurity applications.
• Stay updated on advancements in LLMs and apply them effectively to improve cybersecurity solutions.

Qualifications
• Master's or PhD in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
• Minimum 7 years of experience in data science, with a strong background in machine learning and statistical analysis.
• Experience with training and fine tuning LLMs in heavily preferred but not required.
• Expertise in Python, R, or other data science languages and tools.
• Strong experience with data visualization and communication of complex results.
• Proven leadership skills with experience in mentoring and guiding teams.
• Excellent problem-solving abilities and a strong focus on delivering actionable insights.
• Exceptional communication skills, capable of conveying complex data concepts to a non-technical audience.

About the Organization NetSPI is a fast-growing, dynamic cybersecurity company headquartered in the North Loop of Minneapolis. As the leader in vulnerability orchestration and security testing, we're continually growing, and we pride ourselves on keeping absolutely current and cutting-edge in everything we do.

EOE Statement We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.
